ui.siteDescription: Singapore hawker food guide - make healthier choices with ease
ui.title: Eating Outside?
ui.subtitle: 吃什么?
ui.reassurance: Choose the option that feels safest for your body today.

chicken-rice.name: Chicken Rice
chicken-rice.tip: Cucumber slices add a refreshing crunch to the meal.

fish-soup.name: Fish Soup
fish-soup.tip: Clear broth is hydrating and easy on the stomach.

yong-tau-foo.name: Yong Tau Foo
yong-tau-foo.tip: Tofu and leafy greens are soft and easy to digest.

options.light: Soup base with fresh tofu and greens
options.caution: Dry style with sweet bean sauce
options.avoid: Laksa broth or mostly crispy fried items

ban-mian.name: Ban Mian
ban-mian.tip: Adding extra spinach makes the broth feel more balanced.

options.avoid: Dry style with extra chilli oil and fried ikan bilis

nasi-lemak.name: Nasi Lemak
nasi-lemak.tip: The cucumber and egg provide a nice contrast in texture.

options.light: Plain rice with ikan bilis, egg, and cucumber
options.caution: Coconut rice with otah and wings
options.avoid: Coconut rice with extra sambal and fried sides

wanton-mee.name: Wanton Mee
wanton-mee.tip: Soup on the side helps keep the noodles soft.

options.avoid: Dry version with extra sauce and fried wantons

carrot-cake.name: Carrot Cake
carrot-cake.tip: White carrot cake has a simpler, more savoury flavour profile.

options.light: White version with more egg, less oil

economical-rice.name: Economical Rice
economical-rice.tip: Steamed options are often easier on the palate.

options.light: Two steamed vegetable sides + 1 steamed protein
options.avoid: Multiple fried sides or heavy gravy over rice

laksa.name: Laksa
laksa.tip: Sipping the broth slowly lets you enjoy the spices.

options.avoid: Extra soup or added fried toppings

bak-chor-mee.name: Bak Chor Mee
bak-chor-mee.tip: Vinegar adds a bright tang that cuts through the richness.

options.light: Soup version with minced meat and mushrooms

vision.title: The Vision
vision.content: Eating in Singapore is a national pastime, but it can often feel like a source of stress or "health guilt." Eat Outside was created to help you navigate our beautiful food centres with more ease and less anxiety.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.content: , not restriction. You don't need to stop eating the foods you love to feel better. We don't use calorie counts or clinical language. Instead, we offer simple adjustments that make your favourite meals feel a little lighter on the palate.

howTo.title: How to Use This
howTo.content: Think of this as a gentle friend sitting across the table. Pick your dish and see the options. Whether you choose a Light, Caution, or Avoid version depends entirely on how you feel today—there are no wrong answers.

notMedical.title: Not Medical Advice
notMedical.content: The information provided is for educational and supportive purposes only. We are not medical professionals. Suggestions are based on common preparation methods and general body-feel.

listenBody.title: Listen to Your Body
listenBody.content: Every body is different. Please prioritise your own comfort, medical requirements, and the advice of your healthcare provider.

allergies.title: Allergies & Safety
allergies.content: Always check with hawker stall owners regarding ingredients and allergens. Recipes can change without notice.
